title: Is the Presence of Technology Improving Corporations and Increasing the Prosperity of Investors and Individuals?
descriptions:
The proposed project, "Is the Presence of Technology Improving Corporations and Increasing the Prosperity of Investors and Individuals?", aims to investigate the impact of technology on corporations, investors, and individuals. The project will focus on three key areas: communication with shareholders, environmental and social issues, and compensation in the tech industry.

The first area of focus involves understanding whether the shift to virtual-only shareholder meetings has muted shareholders' voices and limited communication. Initial findings suggest that this shift has minimized communication and allowed firms to strategically avoid addressing shareholder questions.

The second area aims to determine whether investors prioritize firms' stated actions or actual actions on environmental and social issues. Using natural language processing, the project will evaluate the market rewards for firms based on their stated vs. actual actions. Initial results suggest that firms are rewarded for stating actions promoting environmental and social goals, rather than for their actual actions.

Lastly, the project will examine the relationship between employees' characteristics, the Employee Benefit Corporation (EBC) they receive, and their ability to maximize the value of EBC. Specifically focusing on gender in the tech industry, the project aims to understand how changes in economic landscape and welfare of individuals can be influenced by compensation practices.
